sub_title: Building a Better Future through Design Based Education and the Sustainable Development Goals: Entrepreneurship, Tourism, Museums, and Heritage Preservation.
summary:
As a researcher, author, and university lecturer at NHL Stenden, I have extensive experience in developing sustainable regions and international learning and education communities. My work is focused on promoting internationalization and Design Based Education (DBE) in education. In addition, I am a Fellow at the Centre for Religious Heritage at the University of Groningen and have published numerous books and articles in the field of sustainable entrepreneurship, leisure, tourism, cultural heritage, and museums.

My motivation in education is driven by my aspiration to create meaningful learning experiences and promote sustainability. I have always been fascinated by the power of education to bring about positive change and empower individuals to reach their full potential.

With my involvement in multidisciplinary projects at various levels and my passion for sustainability, culture, and community development, I am continually seeking new challenges and projects where I can make a meaningful contribution. I take pride in my involvement in the Veenhuizen project, which has now achieved UNESCO World Heritage status, and look forward to contributing even more to the development of sustainable regions and communities.

I invite you to get in touch so that together, we can explore new possibilities and contribute to the advancement of sustainable education and international learning and education communities.

projects.title: Sultans Trail / Applied international research network
projects.description: De Sultans Trail is een langeafstandswandel- en fietsroute van Wenen naar Istanbul. De lengte is 2500 km en het zou een gemiddelde persoon 15 weken kosten om de hele Sultans Trail te lopen. Fietsers hebben ongeveer 4 weken nodig voor de fietsroute Sultans Trail.

projects.title: Intangible cultural heritage and Tourism
projects.description:
Hoe om te gaan met de commercialisering van immaterieel cultureel erfgoed?
Hoe kun je cultureel erfgoed op de markt brengen zonder dat het een 'gimmick' voor toeristen wordt? Hoe ga je om met de commercialisering van je immaterieel cultureel erfgoed? Deze vragen staan centraal in de onderzoekslijn Immaterieel Erfgoed & Toerisme.

projects.title: Faculty Member Programme Committee (PC)
projects.description: Een opleidingscommissie (PC) is een officieel orgaan dat (on)gevraagd adviseert aan het faculteitsbestuur en de faculteitsraad. Het speelt een belangrijke rol in de besluitvorming binnen de faculteit. De belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheid van elke OC is het bewaken van de kwaliteit van het onderwijs voor (een) bepaalde opleiding(en). Elke opleiding heeft een pc waarin studenten en docenten evenredig vertegenwoordigd zijn. Een PC komt minimaal zes keer per jaar bijeen. Studentleden worden geselecteerd door Quest.

profile_positions.description:
As a Senior Lecturer-Researcher at the Academy of International Business Administration, I specialize in designing sustainable entrepreneurship training programs aligned with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). My work also encompasses a strong focus on Design Based Education (DBE), integrating the principles of design-driven pedagogy into my teaching and research practices. I guide and mentor students while conducting interdisciplinary research over multiple years in this field.

In addition to my academic responsibilities, I serve as a bridge between government bodies, entrepreneurs, local communities, and students, fostering knowledge innovation and scientific advancement. My goal is to bridge the gap between theory and practice, making a meaningful impact on sustainable entrepreneurship.

I am deeply committed to advancing sustainable entrepreneurship in line with the SDGs, and I actively promote collaboration among academia, industry, and government stakeholders. My passion lies in designing innovative learning experiences and creating an engaging environment where students are challenged to think critically and develop their entrepreneurial skills. I strive to empower them to make a positive impact on society and the environment.

I am always eager to explore new opportunities to foster sustainable entrepreneurship and collaborate with diverse stakeholders. Let's connect and explore possibilities to contribute to the development of sustainable entrepreneurship and design-based education.
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer-Researcher NHL Stenden University
Program Coordinator IBMS Innovation and Leadership Graduation Track

profile_positions.description: As a Senior Lecturer-Researcher in Leisure and Event Management / Tourism Management, I was responsible for developing multi-year integrated education programs, supervising students and conducting interdisciplinary multi-year research. I was a key figure in knowledge innovation and research in the field of Leisure and Event Management / Tourism Management.
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer-Researcher Leisure and Event Management / Tourism Management (Hogeschoolhoofddocent)

profile_positions.description:
Member of the management team Leisure and Event Management

As a team leader, I was responsible for leading a team with a predominantly (policy) developing area of focus (including sustainability, accreditation, further development of the Leisure Management research line), advising on multi-year policies and hierarchical leadership. From the role (s) I fulfilled, I contributed as a team member to the result of the management and management team and the ambitions of NHL Stenden.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader Leisure and Event Management

profile_positions.description: As an Assistant Professor I was responsible for the content of a line of research (Sustainable Leadership), providing substantive direction to developments within the research domain, carrying out innovative, complex and multidisciplinary research on the formulated focal points (Sustainable Cities and Communities; SDG11, Heritage and Museums), providing education for the MSc Sustainable Entrepreneurship, the quality of the research, providing education and guiding students in their research.

profile_positions.description:
Professorship Sustainable innovation in the regional knowledge economy

Research at Colonies of Benevolence Veenhuizen & Frederiksoord, District Six Museum Cape Town, Humboldt Forum Berlin, Museum of Boulder.

As a member of the MDK (multidisciplinary chain) within the Professorship Sustainable Innovation in the Regional Knowledge Economy I was engaged in research into the ways in which institutions of (higher) vocational education and the (business) community can work together to bring about sustainable trans disciplinary innovations especially in the fields of leisure economy and cultural heritage.
